record.title: MEASURE PLACED ON THE CALENDAR--H.R. 5140
record.narrative:
MEASURE PLACED ON THE CALENDAR--H.R. 5140 -- (Senate - January 30, 2008)

[Page: S463]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I understand H.R. 5140 is at the desk and due for a second reading.

record.chair: The clerk will report the bill by title for the second time.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
A bill (H.R. 5140) to provide economic stimulus through recovery rebates to individuals, incentives for business investment, and an increase in conforming and FHA loan limits.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I object to any further proceedings at this time.

record.chair: Objection is heard. The bill will be placed on the calendar.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I suggest the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.
The legislative clerk proceeded to call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, it is my understanding the Senate is in morning business?
Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent to speak for 15 minutes.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The Senator from North Carolina is recognized.
record.narrative: (The remarks of Senator BURR pertaining to the introduction of S. 2573 are located in today's Record under "Statements on Introduced Bills and Joint Resolutions.")

speaking.paragraph: I yield the floor and suggest the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.
The assistant legislative clerk proceeded to call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. TESTER.) Without objection, it is so ordered.
